newsitem.title: GERMANY: Bonn farm ministry details EU 1996 grains crop.
newsitem.headline: Bonn farm ministry details EU 1996 grains crop.

text.p: A German agriculture ministry circular on Monday gave an estimate of the European Union 1996 grains crop at 205.7 million tonnes, up 15.6 percent from 1995.

Citing revised data from the European Commission's statistics office, Eurostat, which showed yield, area and volume figures supplied by member states, the circular showed an increase on Eurostat's November 18 estimate for 1996 by 700,000 tonnes.
The area was put at 37.0 million hectares (35.6 million 1995) and average yields at 5.66 tonnes per ha (4.99).
Wheat was pegged at 100.0 million tonnes (87.8 in 1995), barley at 52.9 (43.6), maize at 34.4 (29.8), oats at 7.8 million (6.4), rye at 5.7 (6.1) and triticale at 3.9 (3.0).
The remainder of the balance was mixed grains.
The French crop was put at 62.3 million tonnes (53.4 million previously), followed by Germany's 42.1 (39.9), Britain 24.5 (21.9), Spain 21.8 (11.2) and Italy 19.1 (18.5).
Other details were -- Denmark 9.5 (9.2), Sweden 6.0 (4.8), Austria 4.5 (4.5), Greece 4.2 (4.2), Finland 3.7 (3.3), Belgium 2.5 (2.2), Ireland 2.1 (1.8) and Netherlands 1.7 (1.6).
Figures for Luxembourg and Portugal were not detailed.
